contents: Niagara Falls is the largest waterfall (by volume) in North America. The falls actually consists of three separate components—Horseshoe Falls, American Falls, and Bridal Veil Falls. Combined, the Falls has a mind-boggling average discharge of over 750,000 gallons per second. Over 90% of the volume is said to flow over the Horseshoe Falls (though numbers from some sources don't add up).
